review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2025
review-text: It works almost as good as new but every night and sometimes throughout the day I get alerts of the stylus being ejected when I haven't removed or touched it. The stylus that came with the phone did have a bent, unresponsive tip. My old phones' stylus was fine so I switched them out. There are times where apps crash or freeze but I'll take that over the issues I had with my last phone, which prompted this replacement. It was easy to setup. The phone did come with all the needed parts including a charger and sim card removal tool. The phone was blemish free other than the broken stylus tip. I didn't have any issues getting my data and service transferred over.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2025
review-text: The specific phone I bought, from the specific vendor, had no original parts. When I needed a new screen, the technician showed me the internals, it explained a lot about how oddly it behaved. I love the Note series, and wish they were still making them. (no, the new iteration is not an improvement, for my needs.)

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2025
review-text: Phone is either getting warm when not in use, or the stylist isn't reading even when it's in the phone. Touch screen is going in and out where it won't read when I scroll or unlock the phone. Never had any problems with my previous note

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2025
review-text: I like the phone with no problem hooking up to my phone company. It is really a nice looking phone, but I love the Note phones. It's really sad that Galaxy doesn't make them anymore. The thing that I am NOT HAPPY about it that I have to charge it a couple times a day. The charge runs down real quick. That's the problem with used or refurbished phones.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2025
review-text: Should be put in main title that is not 5G!! Only reason for return.

review-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2025
Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2025
review-text: Everything is fine, besides the sim tray came broken in half.... half is stuck in the phone now I gotta get a replacement...... and figure out how to get the broken half out..... very disappointing but minor.... phone came with small indents on the back... screen is fine...

span: Phone is great, but S pen doesn't connect via Bluetooth like it should.
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2022
review-text: Seller was - CELLULAR GALLERY INC I love the phone, Looks great - no major scratches and it works really good for the most part, the face recognition doesn't always work 100% but it works most of the time.  I didn't however get the proper S pen with this phone.  My phone keeps asking me to connect the S pen via Bluetooth and it wont connect  because it doesn't appear to be the Bluetooth version of the S pen, like i should have received.  I can use it on the phones screen but i have none of the other features i should be getting with on the Note 10 Plus, like camera control with the pen and air motion control w/ the pen.  I am disappointed that I paid a good amount of money for this phone and it didn't come with the proper parts.  Just be aware if you purchase from this seller they may cheap out on the kind of pen the SHOULD provide that actually came with this version of phone.

span: Affordable, enjoyable upgrade from my Note 8, a few issues
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2021
review-text: I am mostly enjoying my 'renewed' Note 10+ and I particularly love the amazing iridescent color. The phone is so lovely I don't want to use a case but for protection I use a thin clear case which is close to the sleek uncovered experience. I wish they'd stop with the curved screen on the Note line, it is frustrating to use the edges and tougher to protect. I appreciate it is running smoothly with Android 11 and I just upgraded to the Android 12 final beta. I do wish Samsung hadn't abandoned their VR Gear products because I enjoyed them and bought headsets and controllers which are now useless. I may still exchange or return the Note 10+ before the 90 day period because I've been annoyed by the speaker often causing the phone to vibrate in an unpleasant way even at medium volume. Also, since switching to it, a number of videos have refused to play correctly, instead showing jagged lines and I can't find anything online about the issue so I am suspecting a memory issue. Overall I love the Note series and I think the Note 10+ is a great phone, especially if I can get these few issues resolved.

span: Beautiful fun phone but beware of used...
review-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
review-text: This phone has a face scanner not a fingerprint reader just to be clear. It works half the time and you need to be in a lit room for it to work properly. The phone is a relatively fast hand-me-down but I'm not impressed with the battery charging time on this phone. If you're using it heavily while charging it's aggravatingly s l o w . But it holds charge for half the day or more and does well once fully charged. The signal isn't the best but that might be the carrier's fault. The phone has an impressive amount of space and I'm happy that it's even more expandable with an SD card slot. I bought the phone for a petty reason- the holographic back casing, lol. It's gorgeous and rainbow reflective. But I'm still impressed by the way it handles. It's better to type and hold with two hands but some tasks can be handled with one. The cameras work great. The main cam lens has stability which is neat.
